RES-20-0032 A RESOLUTION OF THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE A CITY OF LONG BEACH PROCLAIMING THE EXISTENCE OF A LOCAL EMERGENCY DUE TO IMMINENT AND PROXIMATE THREAT TO PUBLIC HEALTH FROM THE INTRODUCTION OF NOVEL CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) CO 00 IN THE CITY, AND RATIFYING THE PROCLAMATION OF LOCAL EMERGENCY BY THE CITY MANAGER AND 10 RATIFYING THE DECLARATION BY THE CITY HEALTH OFFICER OF A LOCAL HEALTH EMERGENCY OFFICE OF THE CITY ATTORNEY CHARLES PARKIN, City Attorney 411 West Ocean Boulevard, 9th Floor Long Beach, CA 90802-4684 12 13 WHEREAS, California Government Code Section 8630, California Health 14 and Safety Code 101080, and Long Beach Municipal Code Section 2.69.060 empowers 15 the City Council to proclaim the existence of a local emergency to protect and preserve 16 public welfare when the City is affected or likely to be affected by a public calamity; and 17 WHEREAS, the City Council finds that the current confirmed cases of Novel 18 Coronavirus (COVID-19) internationally, including California and multiple areas of the 19 United States, have prompted the federal government to declare that a public health 20 emergency exists nationwide; and 21 WHEREAS, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced on 22 February 26, 2020, that community spread of COVID-19 is likely to occur in the United 23 States; and 24 WHEREAS, based on the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention 25 statements, there is an ongoing risk and probability of COVID-19 positive patients being 26 identified in the City of Long Beach; and 27 WHEREAS, the City Council finds that the increase of reported cases and 28 deaths associated with COVID-19 has also prompted the Governor of the State of TMA:db A20-01874 (03-06-2020) 01128272.DOC California, Washington, and Florida to proclaim a state emergency, and Counties of Los 2 Angeles County, Orange, Santa Clara, San Diego, Sonoma, the City and County of San 3 Francisco, the City of Pasadena, to each proclaim a local emergency; and A WHEREAS, as a consequence, the City Health Officer of the City of Long 5 Beach did declare a local health emergency within the City on March 4, 2020; and WHEREAS, as a consequence, the City Manager of the City of Long Beach 7 did proclaim a local emergency within the City on March 4, 2020; and WHEREAS, the City Council finds that that newly identified COVID-19 is an infectious and communicable disease, which creates a condition of extreme peril to the 10 health and safety of persons within the City, and which is likely to be beyond the ability 11 and resources of the City to control; and OFFICE OF THE CITY ATTORNEY CHARLES PARKIN, City Attorney 411 West Ocean Boulevard, 9th Floor Long Beach, CA 90802-4664 12 WHEREAS, a declaration of a local emergency will assist in a coordinated 13 public health response to reduce transmission and illness severity, provide assistance to 14 health care providers, and mitigate the effects of this potential pandemic on the citizens 15 of the City; and 16 WHEREAS, the conditions and circumstances described above warrant and 17 necessitate that the City proclaim the existence of a local emergency; and 18 WHEREAS, the City Council desires to declare a local emergency and to 19 ratify the declaration of a local health emergency by the City Health Officer, and to ratify 20 the proclamation of local emergency by the City Manager, and to authorize the City 21 Manager to enter into any necessary agreements to obtain any emergency assistance to 22 implement necessary intervention activities to prevent a threatened epidemic of disease 23 in the community; 24 NOW, THEREFORE, the City Council of the City of Long Beach resolves as 25 follows: 26 Section 1. Pursuant to California Government Code Section 8630 and 27 Long Beach Municipal Code Section 2.69.060, the City Council hereby finds and 28 proclaims the existence of a local emergency caused by conditions or threatened TMA:db A20-01874 (03-08-2020) 01 126272.DOC conditions of Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in Long Beach which, if not corrected, N constitutes a threatened epidemic with its resultant morbidity and mortality to the extreme 3 peril of health and safety of persons within the territorial limits of the City. A Section 2. Pursuant to Section 101080 of the California Health and Safety Code, the City Council hereby ratifies the declaration by the City Health Officer of E a local health emergency in the City of Long Beach resulting from the presence or potential presence of individuals susceptible to Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) which, if Co intervention measures are not instituted, pose a threat of an epidemic of said disease in the community. The City Health Officer is authorized to take the necessary intervention 10 measures to protect and preserve the public health from said public health hazard. 11 Section 3. The City Manager is hereby authorized to furnish information, OFFICE OF THE CITY ATTORNEY CHARLES PARKIN, City Attorney 411 West Ocean Boulevard, 9th Floor Long Beach, CA 90802-4664 12 to enter into agreements and to take all actions necessary to obtain State emergency 13 assistance to implement preventive measures to protect and preserve the public health of 14 the City from said public health hazard within the scope of the local emergency hereby 15 declared. 16 Section 4. The City Clerk shall certify to the passage of this resolution by 17 the City Council of the City of Long Beach and it shall thereupon take effect. The 18 requirement to renew a local health emergency pursuant to California Health and Safety 19 Code 101080, and the requirement to renew a local emergency pursuant to California 20 Government Code Section 8630, has been waived for the duration of the statewide 21 emergency by the Governor of the State of California in his Proclamation of a State of 22 Emergency dated March 4, 2020. In accordance with the provisions of Long Beach 23 Municipal Code Chapters 2.69 and 2.85, the City Clerk shall include the matter of the 24 necessity for continuing the local emergency and the local health emergency on the City 25 Council agenda for review at least every fourteen (14) days until the City Council 26 terminates said local emergency and local health emergency. 27 Section 5. This resolution shall take effect immediately upon its adoption 28 by the City Council, and the City Clerk shall certify the vote adopting this resolution.
